contents:
The opinion of the court was filed October 6th, 1884.
Pee Curiam.
The fact that this association has some features to distinguish it from a life insurance company does not establish any error in this judgment. The husband inherited from his wife. The cases of Anderson’s Appeal, 4 Norris 202, and Deginther’s Appeal, 2 Id. 337, fully sustain the opinion of the court below, and rulé this case.
Judgment affirmed.
